subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0155_01C9E836.4FD077B0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

That's awesome! I have yet to experience a disembodied voice.

  ----- Orig=
inal Message ----- 
  From: Frank Ratka 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  S=
ent: Monday, June 08, 2009 11:49 AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas




=

        I recorded at a  100 year old beach house investigation in 2004 an=
d not only heard real time, "Hello" with my ears but caught it on camera an=
d my reaction to it.

        Frank R.

        --- On Mon, 6/8/09, Zack Wi=
dup <w9sz.zack@...> wrote:


          From: Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gm=
ail.com>
          Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
          To: EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups.com
          Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 12:40 PM


          I=
 am curious if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote site has ever got=
ten any EVP in real time.

          I took part in an investigation of Ash=
more Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had six video cameras =
set up in the three halls of the building. The video for all was being moni=
tored and recorded at a central location. Alas, we did not have microphones=
 at the camera sites conected to the central location. I wonder what we mig=
ht have heard if we did?

          Zack

           
          On Mon, Jun=
 8, 2009 at 12:05 PM, threadsintyme@ juno.com <Threadsintyme@ juno.com> wro=
te:


          Let's just agree to end this discussion about her... 
     =
     Why don't we discuss something on a lighter note? Anyone have any new =
ideas about either evp or ITC? 
          Al
